title: SOLITAIRE
content:
Do you know the name of this font or something that similar, thank you very much.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Solitaire.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819205408/http:/typophile.com/files/Solitaire.jpg) | 56.01 KB |
author: manukball

comments.content:
Name of this font:  
CastCraft Software /OPTIPegasus-Semibold.  
Long time out of business.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819205408im_/http:/typophile.com/files/solit1_6449.jpg)
  
 [http://www.typophile.com/node/69064](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819205408/http:/www.typophile.com/node/69064)

Perhaps something similar:  
The Foundry/Erato-Bold  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/hoftype/erato\_bold\_ot/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819205408/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/hoftype/erato_bold_ot/)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819205408im_/http:/typophile.com/files/solit2_5954.jpg)

DPape on 12 Mar 2013 — 8:12am:

> Name of this font:  
> CastCraft Software /OPTIPegasus-Semibold.  
> Long time out of business.
> 
> [http://www.typophile.com/node/69064](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819205408/http:/www.typophile.com/node/69064 "http://www.typophile.com/node/69064")

Dick, do you agree with the comments concerning ethics in the thread you linked to?

hhp
Mr Moderator, Mr Moderator - Hrant's trying to provoke me again.

I'm sorry you feel that way - of course I don't want you to feel pressured to reply. Mostly I'm just curious about how people feel about the provenance of certain fonts. And personally I don't think it's good to muzzle open discussion.

hhp
I told you he couldn't last a week.

What do you mean? You don't have to answer any question you don't feel like answering, but there's no reason to cast aspersions.

hhp
